Health Benefits of Kiwi :
  • A kiwifruit has almost twice as much vitamin C than 2 oranges ğŸŠÂ of equal weight. Although vitamin C helps with many health deficiencies and problems.
  • The amount of fiber in a kiwi is almost as much as in 3 celery sticks. Fiber is extremely important for so many reasons but is key for the digestive system to function properly.
  • As much vitamin E as in 3 apples ğŸÂ Â The major benefits of vitamin E are for building strong immunity, healthy looking skin and eye health. Many people take vitamin E supplements for antioxidants, which protect cells from damage.
  • A kiwifruit has almost as much potassium as a large mango.
  • A kiwifruit has the same amount of folate as found in 4 peaches. Folate is the most important nutrient for producing and maintaining new cells. This makes it especially important during pregnancy and for babies. Itâ€™s important for adults as well because itâ€™s necessary for normal blood cell production as well.
Today, I prepared kiwi jam which turned out so creamy, glazy and tasty too. Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Jam recipe: Kiwi fruit ğŸ¥Â  Quantity yields : 400 gms (at the end of processing jam) Duration: 20 mins Ingredients:
  • Kiwi Fruit - Fresh - 7 - 600 gms - peeled off & chopped
  • Granulated Sugar - 420 gms
  • Honey - 1 tb sp
  • Lemon juice - 1/2 tb sp
  • Vanilla Essence - 1 tsp
Procedure:
  • Add chopped kiwi in juicer & make smooth puree
  • Heat a heavy bottom non stick pan over medium heat
  • Add sugar & kiwi ğŸ¥Â puree, mix well
  • Stir continuously till sugar dissolves
  • Next add honey, lemon juice & vanilla essence . Mix well
  • Stir occasionally
  • Cook upto 20 mins on low to medium heat
  • Stir in between and theÂ color of puree slowly changes to dark green color
  • Turn off the heat when the consistency thickens
  • Let it become cool completely at least for an hour
  • Store in an airtight container, to remain fresh and store in refrigerator ( don't freeze)
  • Enjoy this fresh jam on any bread, milk bread, wheat bread or oat bread ğŸ™‚
